result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brittany K. Opelt

defendant.name: Opelt, Brittany K.
defendant.address: W3540 Langdell Rd, Eau Claire, WI 54701

records.addlTxt:
8:43 AM Cases called: 21CF1277, 21CM955 & 22CF375. Defendant Brittany K. Opelt in court.  Attorney James H Krave in court for Brittany K. Opelt.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. This is the time and date set for a plea hearing. The parties have a joint agreement. 

Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1 in 21CT358: OWI 4th. Priors related this charge are acknowledged. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders:
36 months Probation sentence withheld with conditions.
Conditions of Probation:
$600 fine and costs and blood draw fee
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
12 months jail with the last 6 months stayed pending further order of the court. Huber granted as long as defendant qualifies.
36 months driver's license revocation- retroactive
36 months IID
90 days to pay restitution in the amount of $21.19 plus 10% surcharge.

Count 2 in 21CF1277 merges. 21CM955 and 22CF375 are ordered dismissed and read in, including any ride along citations.
 2 days of jail credit in the event of revocation
Plea hearing on September 9, 2022 at 08:45 am.

9:39 AM cases 21CF1277, 21CM955, 22CF375 called. Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brittany K. Opelt in court.  Attorney James H Krave in court for Brittany K. Opelt. 
In all felony files: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. A plea hearing is scheduled for 9/9/22 at 8:45 AM in Branch 4 (in person).

Conditions:
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.

(11:42 AM cases 21CM955, 21CF1277, 22CF375 called.) Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brittany K. Opelt in court without counsel.
Court orders the warrants are quashed and bond continues in cases 21CM955, 21CF1277.
Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing in 22CF375 and bond is set.
Defendant advised of right to an attorney. 
Defendant updates address with the Court.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on May 23, 2022 at 3 pm.
Hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.

Cases called at 9:47 AM: 22CF375, 21CM955, 21CF1277.
Defendant Brittany K. Opelt not in court.  Attorney James H Krave in court for Brittany K. Opelt.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State requests warrant.
Court orders $1,000 or body only warrant.

Cases called at 9:08 AM: 21CF1277, 21CM955, 22CF375.
Defendant Brittany K. Opelt not in court.  Attorney James H Krave appeared by video for Brittany K. Opelt.  Attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance. 
Court orders these matters adjourned to 4/28/22 at 9:20 AM.
Initial appearance on April 28, 2022 at 09:20 am.
